Package com.github.yellowstonegames.smooth

Class CoordGlider

java.lang.Object
com.github.yellowstonegames.smooth.CoordGlider
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGlider
public class CoordGlider extends Object implements IGlider
Allows specifying a smoothly-changing float position using an exact Coord for the start and the end, with a change amount that affects how far a position has moved from start to end. Typical usage sets the start with setStart(Coord) once and the end more than once with setEnd(Coord), changing the end each time the move is complete. The x and y positions are automatically calculated in getX() and getY(), and their values will be different every time setChange(float) is called with a different amount. You can optionally use an Interpolation to make the rate of change different.

    • onComplete

      public void onComplete()
      Description copied from interface: IGlider
      Typically called in IGlider.setChange(float) when change reaches at least 1.0. The default implementation does nothing, but implementing classes are encouraged to have this call a user-supplied Runnable, to give the most flexibility to the user.
      Specified by:
      onComplete in interface IGlider
